reviews.review: Gives brain cancer but fun.

acabou por ser meio enjoativo pra mim, não consegui terminar minhas primeiras 50 horas, mas me divirto jogando. o sistema de perks é uma das coisas que eu mais gosto e, por causa disso, eu gosto mais de jogar de survivor do que de killer, por outro lado, eu não curto muito jogar dbd sozinho, mas jogar de survivor com squad de amigos fechado é bem legal. o jogo também não demora muito pra se entender como funciona e isso é uma de suas maiores qualidades, recomendo bastante, principalmente com amigos.

It's for sure an amazing game. It's very challenging and fun to be chased around by the killer.

I would recommend this to those who enjoy a challenge and don't anger easily, play this game. There are always trolls in every game but with this particular game, do not give them the rage they want.

I would not recommend this game to people who cannot handle their anger, as this game is all player-based and can be quite agitating. 

But all in all it's a great game, and very fun! ^-^
It's trash, but good trash.
Macht richtig spaß und es war das geld auf jedenfall wert
É muito mais divertido em sala fechada (5 amigos), mas também é legal jogar com amigos no modo sobrevivente e sozinho como killer.

I'm going to be honest, I actually like the game. At least watching the gameplay, I mean. However, playing the game yourself is one of the most painful matchup experiences of all time. I am a fairly new player, with none of the meta loadout perks. I really enjoy killer gameplay, so I exclusively play killer. I used to be able to have fun matches against people with similar available perks. But, after MMR system came, I feel extremely powerless. All of the survivors who come against me use the top tier meta perks and items, but I literally have [b]none[/b] of the killer meta perks. At best, I can only force a draw out of my matches. God forbid me for trying new characters, that experience is not something I want any new people experiencing. That is why I [b]do not[/b] suggest buying this game. But I do recommend watching gameplay of it, that is actually fun.

In my opinion this game is a lot like Among Us. The survivors are akin to Among Us crewmates, since they have to do tasks (fixing the generators) before they can leave. The killer reminds me of the impostor, since he can kill the survivors (crewmates), and sabotage the generators. Two notable differences are that there are no emergency meetings, meaning the survivors can only win if they complete their tasks, and that the survivors, not the killer, can jump into the hatch (venting). Thank you for reading, and make sure to buy DBD if you are looking for an Among Us-esque experience!
TLDR Dead by Daylight is Among Us

DBD can be incredible fun but also infuriating at times. It doesn't hold the hand of newcomers and it may take a while for people to understand how the game is intended to be played. Once all of the tiles and mechanics of the game start to make sense that's when it truly becomes an addictive adrenaline fueled game. 

Cons: whether you are playing as killer or survivor you will encounter your fair share of toxic players (Hook camping, tunneling, unsafe hooks, no unhooks, an SWF trolling you as killer) Certain maps need a bit more balance in terms of RNG (Tile placement) and certain killers need a buff (some are coming)

Pros: High adrenaline as survivor, the game is a lot more than what is seems on the surface (perks), variety in play styles as both survivor and killer (perks), Random generator, pallet, door and window locations keep the maps entertaining, constant updates with fixes, new survivors and killers, cross play.

Overall, DBD is the best 4v1 game i've played. Somehow, even in the chaos, the game just works.
